Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
@benohanlon one cannot disable in-app notifications (the little red message indicator) that a new message has been posted without muting every channel and never getting told that any messages arrive
I get that marketing is small amount of staff, but do they really need to spam regular users in multiple channels and then retag those same users with the same message with an `everyone` in announcements? Point being: If you plan on doing an #officialüì¢ tag of `everyone`, then every multi-channel post of that **same** message becomes annoying spam

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: Here's how to mute a single channel @ComputerGenie https://benohanlon.tinytake.com/sf/MjgyMDg1MF84NDY5NTcw.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: How often do you think this is happening @ComputerGenie?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
benohanlon#1119
Content:
@ComputerGenie what I mean is how frequently are you coming across this problem a day?
- less than once?
- once a day?
- more than once a day?

Author: dan.#2473
Content: details aside, i think it's more meaningful if the announcements stay in announcements (unless huge..), and maybe another channel named announcements-discussion for, discussion as applicable

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
We get so much spam reposts about so many things, it's hard to keep track of the actual frequency of when staff does it, but the point remains:
once ever is too frequent

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content:
I disagree with you @ComputerGenie if you're arguing that once ever is too much.

I've scrolled back through announcements and there's on average one or two a day - of which not even half use 'everyone'.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: @benohanlon you're wrong

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: I've said earlier in this discussion I'll reduce the use of 'everyone' outside of announcements, keep it to a min and save for big news.
